topic.title: Discussion: Sample final exam
topic.msg:
Sample Final Exam: Download Sample 1 download

Sample Final Exam: Download Sample 2 download

entry.title: similar salamander
entry.msg: Do we think we're getting the solutions to these before the final so we can use it to study?

entry.title: forward frog
entry.msg: I hope so, the final isn't cumulative, but it is helpful to see his comments so we don't make the same mistakes. He did mention he is nice when grading, so if he doesn't release the midterms he won't double penalize us.

entry.title: supposed squirrel
entry.msg: I think he might upload them once we submit them.

entry.title: striking snipe
entry.msg:
@steven. Final isn't cumulative, by that you mean final will only cover chapters after mid-term? 

Professor seems to be strict in grading, docking points for not adding 0, for not indenting the program.  

Mid-term sucked for me, and yet to get grade on it.  Hoping final wont be like mid-term

entry.title: unfair tick
entry.msg: Did he specifically mention which chapters the final will be on? I am also waiting on my midterm to be graded. I feel like it would help me know the amount I need to study for the final

entry.title: clean bovid
entry.msg: I hope he will post the solution before we take actual final.

entry.title: hollow haddock
entry.msg: Does anyone know when he will grade and submit all of the midterms?

entry.title: supposed squirrel
entry.msg: He already graded mine. I think they should be done early this week.

entry.title: foolish fowl
entry.msg: He did mine a few days ago, you should get yours really soon if you haven't already. Hope you did well!

entry.title: unsightly toad
entry.msg: I also got mine back last Monday.

entry.title: ethnic earthworm
entry.msg: Im with you on waiting to midterm grades to come back.

entry.msg: I'm also still waiting for my midterm grade

entry.msg: I'm also waiting idk

entry.msg: Still waiting too

entry.msg: I already received my midterm grade, seems odd.

entry.title: encouraging dragon
entry.msg: I am also waiting. It seems unfair if he provides feedback to some before the final but others do not get it. So hopefully he can post our grades and feedback by Monday

entry.title: constitutional cattle
entry.msg: Still waiting on my midterm grade also. Hopefully he can get them done soon before the final.

entry.title: cognitive buzzard
entry.msg: Yeah even me. It sucks that some of us are not getting the feedback to this day.

entry.title: continuing centipede
entry.msg: I am still waiting for my grade.

entry.title: inland hummingbird
entry.msg: I think hes slowly getting through them. I got mine a while ago but i know other people are still waiting. Hopefully soon!!

entry.title: pleased orca
entry.msg: Still waiting on mine.

entry.title: broad bird
entry.msg: Yeah, I am so waiting as well.

entry.title: alert ant
entry.msg: Im waiting as well,  I hope it doesn't affect my grade too drastically

entry.title: conscious catfish
entry.msg: I am also the same

entry.title: married llama
entry.msg:
Are we graded on the sample final?

It looks like the sample final is an assignment with 20 points with two example PDF files that appear to be duplicates.

Do we need to submit answers to these sample finals as an assignment?  Both of them?

entry.title: dry cuckoo
entry.msg: I just compared two sample final PDF - they are not identical. Could be from past classes but different years. For the midterm, we did submit the sample solution for 20pt? So I guess the same goes with this exercise. But I don't think we need to do both sets. They are very similar.

entry.title: thoughtless swordtail
entry.msg: I think it might be graded by completion instead of by solution.

entry.title: regulatory pony
entry.msg: I think it counts as a graded assignment and should be submitted.

entry.title: Cole Gannon
entry.msg: Just like with the sample midterm, it's a graded assignment. Not sure if it's completion or if he actually checks the questions, though.

entry.title: adverse anaconda
entry.msg: Better finish it as a good practice for the real final exam.

entry.title: evolutionary earwig
entry.msg: It is better to do the samples so you can be prepared for the actual final exam.

entry.title: broad bird
entry.msg: If you do samples, better chance of you being prepared for the final exam.

entry.title: conscious catfish
entry.msg: Yes

entry.title: grand gopher
entry.msg: What's up with the question regarding spelling correction? I know someone in the discord asked about this, how would we handle a double 'o' in good morning but also handle a double r in morrning? I was going to do a byte by byte comparison then redo if needed?

entry.title: dry cuckoo
entry.msg: My thinking: it is almost like that we have a sort of "dictionary" - Good is valid, but "morrning" is invalid comparing to what is in the dictionary? I also just started this one.

entry.title: federal firefly
entry.msg: The way I plan to handle it is to write a procedure that takes a character and an offset to a string and removes all repetitions of that character. So in the example you would pass the offset to the string and the charac you want to remove duplicates of.

entry.title: early deer
entry.msg: Does anyone know what the format of the final exam will be? The practice exam and the actual one on Canvas say multiple choice and I was wondering if that is the same as the True or False questions. Also, there are a bunch of code analysis questions in the first sample final exam but a lot more coding in the second.

entry.title: total takin
entry.msg: Yes the final is the same as our previous one, in terms of format.

entry.title: broken bird
entry.msg: I think the final will be the same format as the midterm, so I would expect the multiple-choice questions to be derived from the quizzes.

entry.title: evident earwig
entry.msg: The multiple choice exam questions seem to be exactly the same as the multiple choice from the quizzes. Since everything is open book in this class, are we allowed to access the previous quizzes during the exam?

entry.title: gradual gopher
entry.msg: Which sample midterm are we supposed to turn in or both?

entry.title: near mastodon
entry.msg: I know this is from a past midterm but can someone explain to me in-depth again the answers for the last question on the sample midterm where we had to show the values in hexidecimal?
